business.headline: India proposes retaliatory duties at world trade body against US tariffs on autosIndia has proposed to impose an equivalent amount of duty collected from products originating in the United States.

Real Estate vs Mutual Funds: Where should you invest, explains stock market expertOwning a house was once every family's dream, but times have changed. With high prices and new ways to invest, is real estate still smart, or are mutual funds better? A stock market expert explains.

Ankur Mehra says creators must think like startups, not influencersAnkur Mehra, in his new book Pixels to Profits, urges creators to stop chasing follower counts and instead build sustainable, multi-platform businesses.

Success isn't about number of followers in creator economy: Ankur MehraIn a conversation with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, Ankur Mehra, author of Pixels to Profits, explains what it really takes to succeed in the creator economy, and why chasing viral fame or follower counts may be the wrong metric altogether.
Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%

India tags it, West sells it. Can Prada's Kolhapuri row lead to real reform?The luxury brand's new "toe-ring sandal" has ignited not just cultural outrage but also legal action in India, with a Public Interest Litigation filed in the Bombay High Court.

Where are ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms? Why they're missing and what to doIt's ITR season but many taxpayers can't find the ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms on the Income Tax portal yet. If you have capital gains, foreign income or business income, this delay might worry you. The good news is there's an extended deadline this year. Here's why these forms are missing and what you should do next.

SBI credit card rules changing from July 15: Here's what cardholders must knowAt present, many cardholders pay only a small part of their bill to avoid late charges. But now, the way the minimum amount due (MAD) is calculated will change starting July 15, 2025.

One in 4 Indians still below minimum standard of living: World BankDespite a sharp drop in extreme poverty, about one in four Indians still falls below the level needed to meet essential needs and maintain a minimum standard of living.

Sebi bans Jane Street for stock market manipulation. Here's what went wrongUS Trading Firm Jane Street: Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) said the trades executed by the group were "prima facie fraudulent and manipulative" and violated the country's capital market regulations.

Want Rs 36 lakh in 5 years? Know who can avail this government schemeThis government scheme offers guaranteed returns, so you don't have to worry about market ups and downs. For the current quarter, the interest rate is fixed at 7.7% per year.

Why did Soham Parekh work multiple jobs? Indian techie shares his reasonsHe confirmed that he worked at several companies simultaneously and misrepresented his location and employment status in the process.

entertainment.headline: Arijit Singh becomes most followed on Spotify, beats Taylor Swift and Ed SheeranArijit Singh has become the most followed artist on Spotify with 151 million followers, surpassing global stars like Taylor Swift and Ed Sheeran. Despite having fewer monthly listeners, his follower count reflects a strong and dedicated global fan base.

Spirit: Sandeep Reddy Vanga to begin shooting in September, Prabhas to join laterFilming of 'Spirit' begins in September 2025, with Prabhas to join the set in November. The actor will star alongside Triptii Dimri in the upcoming film.

Munawar Faruqui on secret wedding with Mehzabeen Coatwala: It was for my sonMunawar Faruqui shared that his decision to marry Mehzabeen Coatwala was driven by his desire to live with his son, Mikael. The wedding, kept private, happened just a month after the decision and within five months of knowing Mehzabeen.

Metro In Dino X review: Fans impressed with Sara's performance, miss Irrfan'Metro In Dino', which released in theatres today (July 4) has got social media buzzing with reviews. As per X users, actor Sara Ali Khan has delivered an impressive performance.

Battle of Galwan reaction: Fans celebrate Salman Khan in uniform, welcome Bhaijaan's comebackFans celebrated Salman Khan's comeback on Friday as the Bollywood superstar shared the first motion poster of his upcoming film 'Battle Of Galwan.'

Battle of Galwan first look: Salman Khan is intense, fierce in uniformSalman Khan shared the motion poster of his upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan'. The story is based on one of India's most brutal battles fought without a single bullet being fired.

Girl's Day's Bang Minah, actor On Ju-wan set to get marriedK-pop band Girl's Day member Bang Minah and South Korean actor On Ju-wan's agencies have announced their plans to get married. The two worked together in a popular Kdrama.

Exclusive: Kriti Sanon to begin shooting for Cocktail 2 in AugustKriti Sanon has wrapped up shooting for 'Tere Ishk Mein' and is set to begin filming 'Cocktail 2' in August. After an intense schedule, the actor is currently taking a short break before diving into her next project.

Amal Clooney praises supportive husband George Clooney amid split rumoursAmal Clooney opened up about her family life with husband George Clooney, highlighting their strong bond and mutual support amid rumours of a rift. She shared that they continue to prioritise privacy for their children.

Who is Nikita Luther, winner of The Traitors alongside Uorfi Javed?Poker player Nikita Luther is now the winner of the reality TV show 'The Traitors'. She won the show alongside social media influencer Uorfi Javed.

ED questions Telugu film producer Allu Aravind for 3 hours in bank fraud caseTelugu film producer Allu Aravind was questioned by the ED for three hours in a Rs 101.4 crore bank fraud case involving Ramakrishna Electronics and RTPL. The ED seized properties, froze accounts, and uncovered evidence of fund diversion.

Jitendra Kumar to Neena Gupta, Panchayat stars rock vintage sportswear. PicsAfter winning everyone's hearts with its simple story and light-hearted humour, Panchayat Season 4 is ready to impress again! This time, new photos from a fun Pickleball-themed photoshoot are going viral on social media. The pictures feature Jitendra Kumar, Neena Gupta, Sanvikaa, Chandan Roy, Faisal Malik, Durgesh Kumar, and Ashok Pathak in a sporty and stylish tennis court setting. Dressed in vintage-style sports outfits with sweatbands, visors, and rackets, the cast looks both playful and fashionable.

Scarlett Johansson would've done Jurassic World even if she died in first 5 minutesScarlett Johansson has fulfilled her long-held wish to be part of the Jurassic franchise with a lead role in 'Jurassic World: Rebirth'. The BAFTA-winning actor explained how she got to play the lead in the latest film.

Boney Kapoor anxiously waiting for Anshula's return from New York after engagementInfluencer Anshula Kapoor, recently announced her engagement to partner Rohan Thakkar. Her father and film producer Boney Kapoor reacted to the news along with other family members.

Thammudu review: Wild ambitions but tamed execution in Nithiin's survival thrillerRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025'Thammudu' movie review: Despite an intriguing premise and a visually rich setting, 'Thammudu' struggles with coherence, emotional depth, and narrative impact. What could have been a gripping one-night survival thriller turns into a long, meandering ride with fleeting moments of brilliance.

Is India ready to create history with a BTS concert? ARMY weighs inIndia's love for BTS is loud, loyal, and impossible to ignore. With HYBE now entering the Indian market, the dream of a BTS concert feels closer than ever. In this week's K-fix, we discuss whether India is ready to host a show of that scale right now.

Kareena Kapoor fangirls over Brad Pitt in F1: Who wants to be 20…Bollywood actor Kareena Kapoor has expressed her admiration for Brad Pitt after watching 'F1', joining fellow star Deepika Padukone in praising the Hollywood icon. The movie, centred around Formula One racing, has garnered positive reviews and strong box office success since its release.

Bollywood doing to Kartik Aryan what it did to Sushant Singh Rajput: Amaal MallikAmaal Mallik alleged that Bollywood is trying to sideline Kartik Aaryan just like it did with Sushant Singh Rajput. He claimed powerful producers and actors are targeting Kartik, despite his success and strong family support.

Metro In Dino has a hilarious Mirzapur crossover you didn't see comingAnurag Basu has made 'Metro... In Dino' a nuanced narrative. But, the most hilarious scene in the film has nothing to do with its story or character, but with 'Mirzapur' and its iconic Guddu Bhaiya and Kaleen Bhaiya.

general news.headline: After 2 decades, Thackeray brothers to reunite for Marathi cause at mega rallyThe catalyst for the reunion of Raj Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray was their joint opposition to the proposed three-language formula, which prompted the Mahayuti government to backtrack and put the policy on hold.

Government does not speak on matters of religion: India on Dalai Lama succession rowThe Indian government said that it does not take any position on matters of religious belief or practices. The statement comes amid a row over Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama's succession plan.

World Champion D Gukesh wins rapid title at Grand Chess Tour 2025 ZagrebReigning World Champion D. Gukesh won the rapid title at the Grand Chess Tour 2025 Rapid & Blitz in Zagreb, Croatia, on Friday. The 19-year-old scored 14 points out of a possible 18, recovering from an early setback to finish at the top of the standings.

We cheer for West Indies, except vs India, PM quips in Trinidad and TobagoDuring his address to Trinidad and Tobago's Parliament, PM Modi said Indians cheer passionately for the West Indies cricket team except when they play against India. He also highlighted shared democratic values, diaspora ties, and women's empowerment.

After ice bucket, now a governance challenge for netas, babus: Theek Karke Dikhao After the ice bucket challenge, used to raise funds for the neuro-degenerative disorder ALS, here's the viral Theek Karke Dikhao social media campaign in India. People are sharing images of roads with potholes, dug-up pavements and trash-filled urban water bodies on X and Facebook, and challenging politicians and bureaucrats to fix them.

2nd Test: Brook, Smith dazzle but Siraj has the final say on Day 3England vs India, 2nd Test: India ended Day 3 of the second Test on 64 for 1, extending their lead to 244 runs after bowling England out for 407 despite a commanding, unbeaten 184 from Jamie Smith at Edgbaston on Friday.

Why Soham Parekh, the startup scammer, isn't the only one to blameSoham Parekh fraud case: Techie Soham Parekh is at the centre of a storm after he was found to be working for multiple US-based startups while staying in India. It has led to questions about the verification process and how it may be more than meets the eye.

PM receives Trinidad and Tobago's highest honour, a first for any foreign leaderPrime Minister Narendra Modi said that he was honoured to receive the honour and accepted it on behalf of 140 crore Indians. PM Modi is on the second leg of his five-nation visit.

Dalai, dance and disguise: How Tibetan leader hoodwinked China, fled to IndiaIt was a Great Escape in 1959 from Lhasa's Norbulingka Palace, the summer seat of the Dalai Lama, the head of Tibetan Buddhism. Then just 23, the Dalai Lama had no option but to flee Tibet after it became clear that an invitation to a dance event was communist China's bid to imprison him. Disguised as a soldier, he hoodwinked Chinese soldiers and entered India after a gruelling two-week trek.

Day 5 Live: Bhambri-Xingyu progress ahead, Alcaraz wins 1st set vs StruffWimbledon 2025 Day 5 Live Score and Updates: India's Yuki Bhambri and China's Jiang Xinyu have beaten Nicole Melichar-Martinez and Christian Harrison 6-3, 1-6, 7-6 (10-6) in the second-round fixture of mixed doubles. Earlier, Taylor Fritz and Andrey Rublev progressed to the quarterfinals in men's singles.

Air India Express delayed Airbus engine fix, forged records: ReportAir India Express, in a statement, said that it had acknowledged the lapse to the Indian regulator and implemented "remedial action and preventive measures."

Socialist Mamdani faces backlash over mother Mira Nair's $2-million houseZohran Mamdani, New York City's socialist mayoral candidate, may face public scrutiny over his family's wealth. The socialist candidate's mother, Mira Nair, owns a $2-million house in the city. Critics say Mamdani, who owns a four-acre plot in Uganda, is too privileged to be speaking of socialism.

Battle of Galwan first look: Salman Khan is intense, fierce in uniformSalman Khan shared the motion poster of his upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan'. The story is based on one of India's most brutal battles fought without a single bullet being fired.

Twist in Pune rape case: Top cop says woman knew accused, wrote threatening textIn a twist in the Pune rape case, a woman, who was allegedly raped by a man posing as a delivery boy, claimed she knew the accused and wrote the threatening text herself on her phone, city police commissioner Amitesh Kumar said.

Court rejects Saif's plea against move to label ancestral assets 'enemy property'The Madhya Pradesh High Court has set aside a trial court order that declared the Pataudi family, including actor Saif Ali Khan, as heirs to Rs 15,000-crore properties in the state.

Told to give biopsy sample, man's private parts amputated in Assam hospitalA doctor in Assam's Silchar allegedly amputated a man's private parts without consent during a biopsy procedure. The patient from Manipur has filed a complaint against the doctor.

PM served food on Sohari leaf at dinner during Trinidad and Tobago visitPrime Minister Narendra Modi, who is on a two-day visit to Trinidad and Tobago, described Sohari leaves as of great cultural significance.

Why Kashmir's verdant forests are burning this summerThe fire mitigation plan suffers from a serious manpower crisis, with 60-80 poorly equipped staff members patrolling up to 40,000 hectares of mountain forests

Metro In Dino review: Anurag Basu's film is like beauty of the first monsoon rainRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Metro In Dino movie review: Anurag Basu's 'Metro... In Dino' is a gentle reminder of how love seeps into everyday life, much like the first rain of the season. It's an anthology set in Indian metros, where characters feel heart-warmingly real. Basu creates a symphony of romance, regret, and rediscovery.

China gave Pak live inputs on our vectors during Op Sindoor: Top Army generalTop Army general Rahul Singh said that during Operation Sindoor, India tackled a double whammy at the border, as Pakistan received real-time inputs of New Delhi's important vectors from China.

UPSC aspirant bags Rs 9 lakh internship to sleep 9 hours at nightAn UPSC aspirant from Pune has earned Rs 9.1 lakh by sleeping for 60 days as part of a unique internship programme. Pooja Madhav Wavhal was named the 'Sleep Champion of the Year' in the fourth season of the Wakefit Sleep Internship.

Who's a doctor anyway? Vidit Gujrathi, The Liver Doc slug it outA Doctor's Day post by chess grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi has snowballed into a fiery debate about who is actually a "doctor" in India after The Liver Doc slammed him for celebrating his "family of doctors". Many even questioned if the post should have sparked the debate at all.
Can AI make a difference to culinary creations?Yes, bring on the bots. But let us not forget that culinary alchemy still needs fire—of feeling, fatigue, failure and fierce devotion

Court rejects Hindu side's plea to declare Mathura Shahi Idgah disputed structureThe Allahabad High Court has dismissed a petition filed by the Hindu side seeking to declare the Shahi Masjid as a disputed structure. The petition was a part of the Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi case in Mathura.

sports.headline: Jamie Smith breaks 28-year-old record for England with classy 184 vs IndiaJamie Smith broke Alec Stewart's record and registered the highest score by an England wicketkeeper in Tests. Smith scored an unbeaten 184 on Day 3 of the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham.

World Champion D Gukesh wins rapid title at Grand Chess Tour 2025 ZagrebReigning World Champion D. Gukesh won the rapid title at the Grand Chess Tour 2025 Rapid & Blitz in Zagreb, Croatia, on Friday. The 19-year-old scored 14 points out of a possible 18, recovering from an early setback to finish at the top of the standings.

2nd Test: Brook, Smith dazzle but Siraj has the final say on Day 3England vs India, 2nd Test: India ended Day 3 of the second Test on 64 for 1, extending their lead to 244 runs after bowling England out for 407 despite a commanding, unbeaten 184 from Jamie Smith at Edgbaston on Friday.

Ben Stokes fumes at umpires as Jaiswal opts for DRS after 15-second timerEngland captain Ben Stokes had a heated chat with the umpires as India batter Yashasvi Jaiswal was allowed to opt for DRS even after exhausting his 15-second timer.

Yashasvi Jaiswal becomes joint-fastest Indian to reach 2,000 Test runsEngland vs India, 2nd Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal became the joint-fastest Indian to reach 2,000 runs in Test cricket, equalling legends Rahul Dravid and Virender Sehwag.

Siraj shines in Bumrah's absence, picks 6-wicket haul to put India on topEngland vs India, 2nd Test: With Jasprit Bumrah rested, Mohammed Siraj led India's pace attack with a superb six-wicket haul, helping the visitors secure a 180-run first-innings lead against England on Day 3.

Taylor Fritz, Rublev march ahead; Madison Keys, Osaka crash outMadison Keys and Naomi Osaka crashed out in the third round, continuing a turbulent campaign for the US contingent in the women's draw. Meanwhile, Taylor Fritz and Andrey Rublev powered into the fourth round with straight-set wins, navigating delays and physical discomfort with grit and poise.

Neeraj Chopra Classic: Bengaluru's iconic stadium gears up for javelin spectacleNeeraj Chopra Classic: On the eve of a landmark moment in Indian athletics, Bengaluru's Sree Kanteerava Stadium lies in poised silence — the calm before a historic storm. For the first time ever, the nation will witness a world-class javelin spectacle on home soil, led by Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra and 11 elite throwers. The markers are set, the stage is ready, and history is about to be hurled into motion.

Why India can't deny Pakistan entry to multilateral sporting events on its soilWith India's ambitious Olympic bid on the line, the government couldn't afford to block Pakistan from participating in multilateral sporting events on home soil-despite public outrage-fearing it could jeopardise the country's chances of hosting major global tournaments in the future.

Siraj shines in Bumrah's absence, picks 6-wicket haul to put India on topEngland vs India, 2nd Test: With Jasprit Bumrah rested, Mohammed Siraj led India's pace attack with a superb six-wicket haul, helping the visitors secure a 180-run first-innings lead against England on Day 3.

Meanwhile, Taylor Fritz and Andrey Rublev powered into the fourth round with straight-set wins, navigating delays and physical discomfort with grit and poise.

For the first time ever, the nation will witness a world-class javelin spectacle on home soil, led by Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra and 11 elite throwers. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
